headline.main: THE DOMINIONS STAND FIRM; The Years Have Altered Their Basic Pattern, But Old Loyalties Meet the Test of War THE BRITISH COMMONWEALTH AT WAR. Editors: William Yandell Elliott & H. Duncan Hall. 515 pages. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $5. The Dominions Stand Firm

lead_paragraph: " SOME foreigners mock at the British Empire because there are no parchment bonds or hard steel shackles which compel its united action. But there are other forces far more compulsive to which the whole fabric spontaneously responds.
abstract: Elliott, W Y (ed); British Commonwealth at War

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: W Y ELLIOTT AND H D HALL

snippet: " SOME foreigners mock at the British Empire because there are no parchment bonds or hard steel shackles which compel its united action. But there are other forces far more compulsive to which the whole fabric spontaneously responds....
